snippet: In one month’s time, 221 municipalities throughout the state face losing hundreds to millions of dollars each, if the money has not yet been spent on affordable-housing projects within their borders.
abstract: Over $160 million in federal funding for affordable housing projects in 221 municipalities across New Jersey is at risk under deadline set in 2008 for spending Fair Housing Act funds; local governments are scrambling to meet deadlines to prevent forfeiture of the funding to the state. (In the Region/New Jersey)
lead_paragraph: In one month’s time, 221 municipalities throughout the state face losing hundreds to millions of dollars each, if the money has not yet been spent on affordable-housing projects within their borders.

headline.seo: New Jersey/In the Region — Deadline Looms for Spending Affordable-Housing Funds
